- Storyline for ads:
Slide 1: 
Berdasarkan data Hootsuite Januari 2020, pengguna aktif Social Media di Indonesia adalah 160 Juta orang atau 59% dari total populasi Indonesia loh!

Slide 2:
Di antara jutaan pengguna dan berbagai platform Social Media yang ada saat ini, apakah brand kamu sudah memiliki Social Media Presence?

Slide 3:
Apa sih Social Media Presence itu? Apakah Social Media Presence saja cukup untuk meningkatkan brand image dan sales kamu? Well, selalu ada faktor lainnya yang berperan penting. Harus aware dengan trending topics, punya Visual Design yang menarik, membuat audience engage dengan postingan kamu, dan yang paling penting, memiliki perencanaan yang efektif dari awal. 

Slide 4: 
Di Glints, kamu bisa belajar Social Media Planning untuk bisnis, langsung dari expertnya. So, let's build a Legit Social Media Plan for your brand! --> info event.

**Reference**
Lihat Instagram Deka Insights & McKinsey Co 

https://instagram.com/dekainsight?igshid=183zofaelzjaw

https://instagram.com/mckinseyco?igshid=3wzl8m3khccw

**Type:**
IG Feed + Story (JPEG)

**Brief**
- Bikin social media posts yg informative, targeted untuk semua org yg mau tau lebih tentang the Product Lifecycle.
- Layout & design minta super professional, clean, consulting style, extremely premium, corporate feel.

----------

**Content**

Slide 1:

Product Lifecycle: Everything That You Should Know to Keep Your Business Alive

Slide 2:

Every product goes through a series of changes throughout their life. Understanding each phase can help you determine the best strategy to keep your business alive and kicking. 

Slide 3

Phase #0
MVP (Minimum Viable Product)

In this stage, you need to turn your idea into a real product. Before entering the market, it is important to carefully develop each feature to satisfy the prospect market.   

Slide 4:

Phase #1
Market Introduction 

As you are trying to bring your product to the small market, sales are still low and you may receive a lot of feedback from the customers. 

Its better to introduce your imperfect product early, rather than too late and miss your opportunity.  Reid Hoffman (LinkedIn founder)

Slide 5:

Phase #2
Market Growth (Takeoff Stage)

Product market fit has been realized and you can see the significant increase in demand. In this phase, you can focus to expand your market. 

Slide 6:

Phase #3
Market Maturity

Congrats! Your product is a success. Now, it is important to differentiate your product from competing products and strive for the markets growth. 

Slide 7:

Phase #4
Market Decline

As market saturation begins to set in, your product has lost its competitive edge and you can see the sales drift downward. 

It is a natural phase of every product, but you can restart the lifecycle once again by adding new features or introducing an entirely new product.

**8. Additional Request**
a. Storyline:

Drive Performance with OKRs - Make Impactful Decisions

Objective and key results (OKRs) boost efficacy and engagement by telling managers which team members are engaged. This information is easily accessible through a weekly OKR goals check-in process, which gives managers visibility into whos achieving their OKRs. OKRs help managers build high-performing teams by empowering and engaging individuals so that theyll be better at their work. 

Why do companies use OKRs
Traditionally, companies set high-level organizational goals at the beginning of the year, and then everyone forgets about them within a month. This leads to passive management. It becomes difficult for leaders to measure and track their employees progress and goal achievement. Executives and managers have a hard time understanding which teams or individuals are achieving, overachieving, or underachieving. It becomes difficult to align different teams and individuals and cascade goals to the company-level goals, so people feel disconnected from the bottom up. There is little clarity among workers about how their actions connect to what matters to the organization. Its also hard to build a measurable, predictable, and repeatable business model when working this way.

To combat the issue, companies attempt to set goals in Microsoft PowerPoint or Excel or Google Docs, and then communicate these goals via email. This is a very static process, and many companies cant manage or track goal progress with this approach. With static approaches like these, goals arent available or visible to everyone in real-time, People cant connect their work to invisible goals. To combat this, many companies have adopted the OKR goal-setting methodology, OKR tracking techniques, and keep their goals aligned using tools like Workfront Goals.

b. Sessions:
Session 1 - OKR Setting 101
1. Understanding OKR framework and roadmap
2. HR role in OKR management
3. OKR vs KPI (or another traditional goal-setting method)
4. Types of OKR
5. How to write an effective OKR
6. Common mistakes in writing OKR and how to avoid them
7. How to Breakdown Company Purpose to Company OKR
8. How to Breakdown Company OKR to Department & Team OKRs

Session 2 - Operationalizing OKR
1. Understanding OKR applications or tools
2. OKR Setting Simulation: Using HR Division as Examples
3. Building OKR Dashboard and Scoring system
4. How to align OKR with HR initiatives (performance management, career planning, people development)
5. How to do OKR Cycle coaching for leaders
6. How to assess OKR effectiveness from targets that have been made (fixed or stretch goals)
7. How to communicate with colleagues or leaders if they do not reach a predetermined target
cards.name: (GEC) 522 HR Workshop: Effective OKR Management for HR Professionals

cards.desc:
**IG Feed - Carousel**

Final File : JPG + PSD

beri image yg sesuai


**Copy**

**Slide 1:**
Resep Brownies
Dari 4 Bahan!

**Slide 2:**
Bahan-bahan yang digunakan:
- 3 buah pisang 
- 225 gram L'AGIE Spread
- 90 gram bubuk cokelat
- Garam sesuai selera

**Slide 3:**
Cara Membuatnya:
1. Panaskan oven dengan suhu 180 derajat 
2. Siapkan wadah, lalu haluskan pisang sampai selembut krim
3. Masukkan L'AGIE Spread yang sudah dihangatkan
4. Masukkan juga bubuk cokelat. Aduk hingga rata
5. Siapkan loyang dan semprot dengan minyak kue
6. Tuang adonan dan taburkan sejumput garam
7. Panggang selama 35-40 menit
8. Setelah tak lengket dan matang, angkat dan sajikan

**ASSETS**
https://www.dropbox.com/sh/sun6bpmzc11xwrc/AAA-IToNpiGDHOp83PDnZqlqa?dl=0

**Reference**
Lihat Instagram Deka Insights & McKinsey Co 

https://instagram.com/dekainsight?igshid=183zofaelzjaw

https://instagram.com/mckinseyco?igshid=3wzl8m3khccw

**Type:**
IG Feed + Story (JPEG)

**Brief**
- Bikin social media posts yg informative, targeted untuk semua org yg mau tau lebih tentang Product development journey saat pandemic ini. 
- Layout & design minta super professional, clean, consulting style, extremely premium, corporate feel.

----------

**Content**

Slide 1:

Product Development in Pandemic

80% of product developers are forced to delay their product development, but you still can be the 20%!

Slide 2:

What is happening right now?

As the government tries to prevent contact between people, your company may experience a decline in sales, especially if your business is vulnerable to COVID-19. 

These industries are most impacted by COVID-19: Hospitality, Travel, Restaurant, Manufacturing, and Construction. 

Slide 3:

Take This Opportunity to Turn Digital!

If there is a possibility to turn your business into digital, then this is the most perfect time to do so. 
If you sell a physical product, you can use delivery services like Gojek or Grab to proactively reach your customers. 

If the problem lies in the inability to do direct promotion, then you can start diving into digital marketing. 

Slide 4:

Harvard Business Review revealed how these big brands manage to overcome this pandemic era. 

- Spotify
As many companies cut up their budget for advertisement, Spotify should find other ways for monetization. 
They realized how artists upload more than 150,000 podcasts/month and use this opportunity to offer exclusive podcast contents for the users. 

- Unilever
One of the biggest FMCG brands in the world is also affected by the pandemic. While demand for skin care and other products has fallen, they prioritize packaged food, surface cleaners, and personal hygiene products that are high on demand. 
While many businesses see pandemic as a major challenge, you can turn it into your advantages or even strive to catch up with the big brand. 

Slide 5:

What do you think? Is this pandemic a disaster or it turns out to be a great opportunity?

Share your story in the column section!

4 Tips Anti Lemas Saat Puasa
